class.name: PinJoint3D
class.brief_description: A physics joint that attaches two 3D physics bodies at a single point, allowing them to freely rotate.
class.description: A physics joint that attaches two 3D physics bodies at a single point, allowing them to freely rotate. For example, a [RigidBody3D] can be attached to a [StaticBody3D] to create a pendulum or a seesaw.

method.name: get_applied_force
method.description: Returns the applied force to the joint. Notice: This only returns a correct value in Jolt Physics

method.name: get_param
method.description: Returns the value of the specified parameter.

method.name: set_param
method.description: Sets the value of the specified parameter.

members.member: The force with which the pinned objects stay in positional relation to each other. The higher, the stronger.
The force with which the pinned objects stay in velocity relation to each other. The higher, the stronger.
If above 0, this value is the maximum value for an impulse that this Joint3D produces.
